intro: Triceras tricuspidatum var. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular triceras, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive glandular surface that secretes a sticky substance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
